00138 #define SPECIAL_IMG_PARENT 1

00155 static int compare_name(const void *a1, const void *a2)
00156 {
00157     const struct direntry *entry1=a1, *entry2=a2;
00158 
00159     /* type is equal to stat.st_mode */
00160 
00161     if (S_ISDIR(entry1->type)) {
00162         if (S_ISDIR(entry2->type)==0) return (-1);
00163     }
00164     else {
00165         if (S_ISDIR(entry2->type)) return (1);
00166     }
00167     if (S_ISREG(entry1->type)) {
00168         if (S_ISREG(entry2->type)==0) return (-1);
00169     }
00170     else {
00171         if (S_ISREG(entry2->type)) return (1);
00172     }
00173     if ((entry1->type & S_IFMT) < (entry2->type & S_IFMT)) return (-1);
00174     if ((entry1->type & S_IFMT) > (entry2->type & S_IFMT)) return (1);
00175     
00176     /* make sure "." and ".." are always first */
00177     if ( strcmp(entry1->relname, ".")==0 ) return (-1);
00178     if ( strcmp(entry2->relname, ".")==0 ) return (1);
00179     if ( strcmp(entry1->relname, "..")==0 ) return (-1);
00180     if ( strcmp(entry2->relname, "..")==0 ) return (1);
00181     
00182     return (BLI_natstrcmp(entry1->relname,entry2->relname));
00183 }
00184 
00185 static int compare_date(const void *a1, const void *a2) 
00186 {
00187     const struct direntry *entry1=a1, *entry2=a2;
00188     
00189     /* type is equal to stat.st_mode */
00190 
00191     if (S_ISDIR(entry1->type)) {
00192         if (S_ISDIR(entry2->type)==0) return (-1);
00193     }
00194     else {
00195         if (S_ISDIR(entry2->type)) return (1);
00196     }
00197     if (S_ISREG(entry1->type)) {
00198         if (S_ISREG(entry2->type)==0) return (-1);
00199     }
00200     else {
00201         if (S_ISREG(entry2->type)) return (1);
00202     }
00203     if ((entry1->type & S_IFMT) < (entry2->type & S_IFMT)) return (-1);
00204     if ((entry1->type & S_IFMT) > (entry2->type & S_IFMT)) return (1);
00205 
00206     /* make sure "." and ".." are always first */
00207     if ( strcmp(entry1->relname, ".")==0 ) return (-1);
00208     if ( strcmp(entry2->relname, ".")==0 ) return (1);
00209     if ( strcmp(entry1->relname, "..")==0 ) return (-1);
00210     if ( strcmp(entry2->relname, "..")==0 ) return (1);
00211     
00212     if ( entry1->s.st_mtime < entry2->s.st_mtime) return 1;
00213     if ( entry1->s.st_mtime > entry2->s.st_mtime) return -1;
00214     
00215     else return BLI_natstrcmp(entry1->relname,entry2->relname);
00216 }
00217 
00218 static int compare_size(const void *a1, const void *a2) 
00219 {
00220     const struct direntry *entry1=a1, *entry2=a2;
00221 
00222     /* type is equal to stat.st_mode */
00223 
00224     if (S_ISDIR(entry1->type)) {
00225         if (S_ISDIR(entry2->type)==0) return (-1);
00226     }
00227     else {
00228         if (S_ISDIR(entry2->type)) return (1);
00229     }
00230     if (S_ISREG(entry1->type)) {
00231         if (S_ISREG(entry2->type)==0) return (-1);
00232     }
00233     else {
00234         if (S_ISREG(entry2->type)) return (1);
00235     }
00236     if ((entry1->type & S_IFMT) < (entry2->type & S_IFMT)) return (-1);
00237     if ((entry1->type & S_IFMT) > (entry2->type & S_IFMT)) return (1);
00238 
00239     /* make sure "." and ".." are always first */
00240     if ( strcmp(entry1->relname, ".")==0 ) return (-1);
00241     if ( strcmp(entry2->relname, ".")==0 ) return (1);
00242     if ( strcmp(entry1->relname, "..")==0 ) return (-1);
00243     if ( strcmp(entry2->relname, "..")==0 ) return (1);
00244     
00245     if ( entry1->s.st_size < entry2->s.st_size) return 1;
00246     if ( entry1->s.st_size > entry2->s.st_size) return -1;
00247     else return BLI_natstrcmp(entry1->relname,entry2->relname);
00248 }

00250 static int compare_extension(const void *a1, const void *a2)
00251 {
00252     const struct direntry *entry1=a1, *entry2=a2;
00253     const char *sufix1, *sufix2;
00254     const char *nil="";
00255 
00256     if (!(sufix1= strstr (entry1->relname, ".blend.gz"))) 
00257         sufix1= strrchr (entry1->relname, '.');
00258     if (!(sufix2= strstr (entry2->relname, ".blend.gz")))
00259         sufix2= strrchr (entry2->relname, '.');
00260     if (!sufix1) sufix1= nil;
00261     if (!sufix2) sufix2= nil;
00262 
00263     /* type is equal to stat.st_mode */
00264 
00265     if (S_ISDIR(entry1->type)) {
00266         if (S_ISDIR(entry2->type)==0) return (-1);
00267     }
00268     else {
00269         if (S_ISDIR(entry2->type)) return (1);
00270     }
00271     if (S_ISREG(entry1->type)) {
00272         if (S_ISREG(entry2->type)==0) return (-1);
00273     }
00274     else {
00275         if (S_ISREG(entry2->type)) return (1);
00276     }
00277     if ((entry1->type & S_IFMT) < (entry2->type & S_IFMT)) return (-1);
00278     if ((entry1->type & S_IFMT) > (entry2->type & S_IFMT)) return (1);
00279     
00280     /* make sure "." and ".." are always first */
00281     if ( strcmp(entry1->relname, ".")==0 ) return (-1);
00282     if ( strcmp(entry2->relname, ".")==0 ) return (1);
00283     if ( strcmp(entry1->relname, "..")==0 ) return (-1);
00284     if ( strcmp(entry2->relname, "..")==0 ) return (1);
00285     
00286     return (BLI_strcasecmp(sufix1, sufix2));
00287 }
00288 
00289 static int is_hidden_file(const char* filename, short hide_dot)
00290 {
00291     int is_hidden=0;
00292 
00293     if (hide_dot) {
00294         if (filename[0]=='.' && filename[1]!='.' && filename[1]!=0) {
00295             is_hidden=1; /* ignore .file */
00296         }
00297         else if (((filename[0] == '.') && (filename[1] == 0) )) {
00298             is_hidden=1; /* ignore . */
00299         }
00300         else {
00301             int len=strlen(filename);
00302             if ( (len>0) && (filename[len-1]=='~') ) {
00303                 is_hidden=1;  /* ignore file~ */
00304             }
00305         } 
00306     }
00307     else {
00308         if (((filename[0] == '.') && (filename[1] == 0) )) {
00309             is_hidden=1; /* ignore . */
00310         }
00311     }
00312     return is_hidden;
00313 }
00314 
00315 static int is_filtered_file(struct direntry* file, const char* UNUSED(dir), unsigned int filter, short hide_dot)
00316 {
00317     int is_filtered=0;
00318     if (filter) {
00319         if (file->flags & filter) {
00320             is_filtered=1;
00321         }
00322         else if (file->type & S_IFDIR) {
00323             if (filter & FOLDERFILE) {
00324                 is_filtered = 1;
00325             }
00326         }
00327     }
00328     else {
00329         is_filtered = 1;
00330     }
00331     return is_filtered && !is_hidden_file(file->relname, hide_dot);
00332 }
00333 
00334 static int is_filtered_lib(struct direntry* file, const char* dir, unsigned int filter, short hide_dot)
00335 {
00336     int is_filtered=0;
00337     char tdir[FILE_MAX], tgroup[GROUP_MAX];
00338     if (BLO_is_a_library(dir, tdir, tgroup)) {
00339         is_filtered = !is_hidden_file(file->relname, hide_dot);
00340     }
00341     else {
00342         is_filtered = is_filtered_file(file, dir, filter, hide_dot);
00343     }
00344     return is_filtered;
00345 }
00346 
00347 static int is_filtered_main(struct direntry* file, const char* UNUSED(dir), unsigned int UNUSED(filter), short hide_dot)
00348 {
00349     return !is_hidden_file(file->relname, hide_dot);
00350 }
00351 
00352 void filelist_filter(FileList* filelist)
00353 {
00354     int num_filtered = 0;
00355     int i, j;
00356     
00357     if (!filelist->filelist)
00358         return;
00359 
00360     // How many files are left after filter ?
00361     for (i = 0; i < filelist->numfiles; ++i) {
00362         struct direntry *file = &filelist->filelist[i];
00363         if ( filelist->filterf(file, filelist->dir, filelist->filter, filelist->hide_dot) ) {
00364             num_filtered++;
00365         } 
00366     }
00367     
00368     if (filelist->fidx) {
00369         MEM_freeN(filelist->fidx);
00370         filelist->fidx = NULL;
00371     }
00372     filelist->fidx = (int *)MEM_callocN(num_filtered*sizeof(int), "filteridx");
00373     filelist->numfiltered = num_filtered;
00374 
00375     for (i = 0, j=0; i < filelist->numfiles; ++i) {
00376         struct direntry *file = &filelist->filelist[i];
00377         if ( filelist->filterf(file, filelist->dir, filelist->filter, filelist->hide_dot) ) {
00378             filelist->fidx[j++] = i;
00379         }
00380     }
00381 }
00382 
00383 void filelist_init_icons(void)
00384 {
00385     short x, y, k;
00386     ImBuf *bbuf;
00387     ImBuf *ibuf;
00388 #ifdef WITH_HEADLESS
00389     bbuf = NULL;
00390 #else
00391     bbuf = IMB_ibImageFromMemory((unsigned char*)datatoc_prvicons, datatoc_prvicons_size, IB_rect, "<splash>");
00392 #endif
00393     if (bbuf) {
00394         for (y=0; y<SPECIAL_IMG_ROWS; y++) {
00395             for (x=0; x<SPECIAL_IMG_COLS; x++) {
00396                 int tile = SPECIAL_IMG_COLS*y + x; 
00397                 if (tile < SPECIAL_IMG_MAX) {
00398                     ibuf = IMB_allocImBuf(SPECIAL_IMG_SIZE, SPECIAL_IMG_SIZE, 32, IB_rect);
00399                     for (k=0; k<SPECIAL_IMG_SIZE; k++) {
00400                         memcpy(&ibuf->rect[k*SPECIAL_IMG_SIZE], &bbuf->rect[(k+y*SPECIAL_IMG_SIZE)*SPECIAL_IMG_SIZE*SPECIAL_IMG_COLS+x*SPECIAL_IMG_SIZE], SPECIAL_IMG_SIZE*sizeof(int));
00401                     }
00402                     gSpecialFileImages[tile] = ibuf;
00403                 }
00404             }
00405         }
00406         IMB_freeImBuf(bbuf);
00407     }
00408 }
00409 
00410 void filelist_free_icons(void)
00411 {
00412     int i;
00413     for (i=0; i < SPECIAL_IMG_MAX; ++i) {
00414         IMB_freeImBuf(gSpecialFileImages[i]);
00415         gSpecialFileImages[i] = NULL;
00416     }
00417 }

00419 //-----------------FOLDERLIST (previous/next) --------------//
00420 struct ListBase* folderlist_new(void)
00421 {
00422     ListBase* p = MEM_callocN( sizeof(ListBase), "folderlist" );
00423     return p;
00424 }
00425 
00426 void folderlist_popdir(struct ListBase* folderlist, char *dir)
00427 {
00428     const char *prev_dir;
00429     struct FolderList *folder;
00430     folder = folderlist->last;
00431 
00432     if (folder) {
00433         // remove the current directory
00434         MEM_freeN(folder->foldername);
00435         BLI_freelinkN(folderlist, folder);
00436 
00437         folder = folderlist->last;
00438         if (folder) {
00439             prev_dir = folder->foldername;
00440             BLI_strncpy(dir, prev_dir, FILE_MAXDIR);
00441         }
00442     }
00443     // delete the folder next or use setdir directly before PREVIOUS OP
00444 }
00445 
00446 void folderlist_pushdir(ListBase* folderlist, const char *dir)
00447 {
00448     struct FolderList *folder, *previous_folder;
00449     previous_folder = folderlist->last;
00450 
00451     // check if already exists
00452     if (previous_folder && previous_folder->foldername) {
00453         if (BLI_path_cmp(previous_folder->foldername, dir)==0) {
00454             return;
00455         }
00456     }
00457 
00458     // create next folder element
00459     folder = (FolderList*)MEM_mallocN(sizeof(FolderList),"FolderList");
00460     folder->foldername = (char*)MEM_mallocN(sizeof(char)*(strlen(dir)+1), "foldername");
00461     folder->foldername[0] = '\0';
00462 
00463     BLI_strncpy(folder->foldername, dir, FILE_MAXDIR);
00464 
00465     // add it to the end of the list
00466     BLI_addtail(folderlist, folder);
00467 }
00468 
00469 int folderlist_clear_next(struct SpaceFile *sfile)
00470 {
00471     struct FolderList *folder;
00472 
00473     // if there is no folder_next there is nothing we can clear
00474     if (!sfile->folders_next)
00475         return 0;
00476 
00477     // if previous_folder, next_folder or refresh_folder operators are executed it doesn't clear folder_next
00478     folder = sfile->folders_prev->last;
00479     if ((!folder) ||(BLI_path_cmp(folder->foldername, sfile->params->dir) == 0))
00480         return 0;
00481 
00482     // eventually clear flist->folders_next
00483     return 1;
00484 }
00485 
00486 /* not listbase itself */
00487 void folderlist_free(ListBase* folderlist)
00488 {
00489     if (folderlist) {
00490         FolderList *folder;
00491         for (folder= folderlist->first; folder; folder= folder->next)
00492             MEM_freeN(folder->foldername);
00493         BLI_freelistN(folderlist);
00494     }
00495 }
00496 
00497 ListBase *folderlist_duplicate(ListBase* folderlist)
00498 {
00499     
00500     if (folderlist) {
00501         ListBase *folderlistn= MEM_callocN(sizeof(ListBase), "copy folderlist");
00502         FolderList *folder;
00503         
00504         BLI_duplicatelist(folderlistn, folderlist);
00505         
00506         for (folder= folderlistn->first; folder; folder= folder->next) {
00507             folder->foldername= MEM_dupallocN(folder->foldername);
00508         }
00509         return folderlistn;
00510     }
00511     return NULL;
00512 }

00515 static void filelist_read_main(struct FileList* filelist);
00516 static void filelist_read_library(struct FileList* filelist);
00517 static void filelist_read_dir(struct FileList* filelist);
00518 
00519 //------------------FILELIST------------------------//
00520 struct FileList*    filelist_new(short type)
00521 {
00522     FileList* p = MEM_callocN( sizeof(FileList), "filelist" );
00523     switch(type) {
00524         case FILE_MAIN:
00525             p->readf = filelist_read_main;
00526             p->filterf = is_filtered_main;
00527             break;
00528         case FILE_LOADLIB:
00529             p->readf = filelist_read_library;
00530             p->filterf = is_filtered_lib;
00531             break;
00532         default:
00533             p->readf = filelist_read_dir;
00534             p->filterf = is_filtered_file;
00535 
00536     }
00537     return p;
00538 }
00539 
00540 
00541 void filelist_free(struct FileList* filelist)
00542 {
00543     int i;
00544 
00545     if (!filelist) {
00546         printf("Attempting to delete empty filelist.\n");
00547         return;
00548     }
00549     
00550     if (filelist->fidx) {
00551         MEM_freeN(filelist->fidx);
00552         filelist->fidx = NULL;
00553     }
00554 
00555     for (i = 0; i < filelist->numfiles; ++i) {
00556         if (filelist->filelist[i].image) {          
00557             IMB_freeImBuf(filelist->filelist[i].image);
00558         }
00559         filelist->filelist[i].image = NULL;
00560         if (filelist->filelist[i].relname)
00561             MEM_freeN(filelist->filelist[i].relname);
00562         if (filelist->filelist[i].path)
00563             MEM_freeN(filelist->filelist[i].path);
00564         filelist->filelist[i].relname = NULL;
00565         if (filelist->filelist[i].string)
00566             MEM_freeN(filelist->filelist[i].string);
00567         filelist->filelist[i].string = NULL;
00568     }
00569     
00570     filelist->numfiles = 0;
00571     free(filelist->filelist);
00572     filelist->filelist = NULL;  
00573     filelist->filter = 0;
00574     filelist->filter_glob[0] = '\0';
00575     filelist->numfiltered =0;
00576     filelist->hide_dot =0;
00577 }
00578 
00579 void filelist_freelib(struct FileList* filelist)
00580 {
00581     if (filelist->libfiledata)
00582         BLO_blendhandle_close(filelist->libfiledata);
00583     filelist->libfiledata= NULL;
00584 }

00617 struct ImBuf * filelist_getimage(struct FileList* filelist, int index)
00618 {
00619     ImBuf* ibuf = NULL;
00620     int fidx = 0;   
00621     if ( (index < 0) || (index >= filelist->numfiltered) ) {
00622         return NULL;
00623     }
00624     fidx = filelist->fidx[index];
00625     ibuf = filelist->filelist[fidx].image;
00626 
00627     return ibuf;
00628 }
00629 
00630 struct ImBuf * filelist_geticon(struct FileList* filelist, int index)
00631 {
00632     ImBuf* ibuf= NULL;
00633     struct direntry *file= NULL;
00634     int fidx = 0;   
00635     if ( (index < 0) || (index >= filelist->numfiltered) ) {
00636         return NULL;
00637     }
00638     fidx = filelist->fidx[index];
00639     file = &filelist->filelist[fidx];
00640     if (file->type & S_IFDIR) {
00641         if ( strcmp(filelist->filelist[fidx].relname, "..") == 0) {
00642             ibuf = gSpecialFileImages[SPECIAL_IMG_PARENT];
00643         }
00644         else if (strcmp(filelist->filelist[fidx].relname, ".") == 0) {
00645             ibuf = gSpecialFileImages[SPECIAL_IMG_REFRESH];
00646         }
00647         else {
00648             ibuf = gSpecialFileImages[SPECIAL_IMG_FOLDER];
00649         }
00650     }
00651     else {
00652         ibuf = gSpecialFileImages[SPECIAL_IMG_UNKNOWNFILE];
00653     }
00654 
00655     if (file->flags & BLENDERFILE) {
00656         ibuf = gSpecialFileImages[SPECIAL_IMG_BLENDFILE];
00657     }
00658     else if ( (file->flags & MOVIEFILE) || (file->flags & MOVIEFILE_ICON) ) {
00659         ibuf = gSpecialFileImages[SPECIAL_IMG_MOVIEFILE];
00660     }
00661     else if (file->flags & SOUNDFILE) {
00662         ibuf = gSpecialFileImages[SPECIAL_IMG_SOUNDFILE];
00663     }
00664     else if (file->flags & PYSCRIPTFILE) {
00665         ibuf = gSpecialFileImages[SPECIAL_IMG_PYTHONFILE];
00666     }
00667     else if (file->flags & FTFONTFILE) {
00668         ibuf = gSpecialFileImages[SPECIAL_IMG_FONTFILE];
00669     }
00670     else if (file->flags & TEXTFILE) {
00671         ibuf = gSpecialFileImages[SPECIAL_IMG_TEXTFILE];
00672     }
00673     else if (file->flags & IMAGEFILE) {
00674         ibuf = gSpecialFileImages[SPECIAL_IMG_LOADING];
00675     }
00676 
00677     return ibuf;
00678 }
00679 
00680 struct direntry * filelist_file(struct FileList* filelist, int index)
00681 {
00682     int fidx = 0;
00683     
00684     if ( (index < 0) || (index >= filelist->numfiltered) ) {
00685         return NULL;
00686     }
00687     fidx = filelist->fidx[index];
00688 
00689     return &filelist->filelist[fidx];
00690 }
00691 
00692 int filelist_find(struct FileList* filelist, const char *filename)
00693 {
00694     int index = -1;
00695     int i;
00696     int fidx = -1;
00697     
00698     if (!filelist->fidx) 
00699         return fidx;
00700 
00701     
00702     for (i = 0; i < filelist->numfiles; ++i) {
00703         if ( strcmp(filelist->filelist[i].relname, filename) == 0) { /* not dealing with user input so don't need BLI_path_cmp */
00704             index = i;
00705             break;
00706         }
00707     }
00708 
00709     for (i = 0; i < filelist->numfiltered; ++i) {
00710         if (filelist->fidx[i] == index) {
00711             fidx = i;
00712             break;
00713         }
00714     }
00715     return fidx;
00716 }
00717 
00718 void filelist_hidedot(struct FileList* filelist, short hide)
00719 {
00720     filelist->hide_dot = hide;
00721 }
00722 
00723 void filelist_setfilter(struct FileList* filelist, unsigned int filter)
00724 {
00725     filelist->filter = filter;
00726 }
00727 
00728 void filelist_setfilter_types(struct FileList* filelist, const char *filter_glob)
00729 {
00730     BLI_strncpy(filelist->filter_glob, filter_glob, sizeof(filelist->filter_glob));
00731 }
00732 
00733 static int file_is_blend_backup(const char *str)
00734 {
00735     short a, b;
00736     int retval= 0;
00737     
00738     a= strlen(str);
00739     b= 7;
00740     
00741     if (a==0 || b>=a);
00742     else {
00743         char *loc;
00744         
00745         if (a > b+1)
00746             b++;
00747         
00748         /* allow .blend1 .blend2 .blend32 */
00749         loc= BLI_strcasestr(str+a-b, ".blend");
00750         
00751         if (loc)
00752             retval= 1;
00753     }
00754     
00755     return (retval);
00756 }
00757 
00758 
00759 static int file_extension_type(const char *relname)
00760 {
00761     if (BLO_has_bfile_extension(relname)) {
00762         return BLENDERFILE;
00763     }
00764     else if (file_is_blend_backup(relname)) {
00765         return BLENDERFILE_BACKUP;
00766     }
00767     else if (BLI_testextensie(relname, ".py")) {
00768         return PYSCRIPTFILE;
00769     }
00770     else if (BLI_testextensie(relname, ".txt")  ||
00771              BLI_testextensie(relname, ".glsl") ||
00772              BLI_testextensie(relname, ".data"))
00773     {
00774         return TEXTFILE;
00775     }
00776     else if (BLI_testextensie(relname, ".ttf") ||
00777              BLI_testextensie(relname, ".ttc") ||
00778              BLI_testextensie(relname, ".pfb") ||
00779              BLI_testextensie(relname, ".otf") ||
00780              BLI_testextensie(relname, ".otc"))
00781     {
00782         return FTFONTFILE;          
00783     }
00784     else if (BLI_testextensie(relname, ".btx")) {
00785         return BTXFILE;
00786     }
00787     else if (BLI_testextensie(relname, ".dae")) {
00788         return COLLADAFILE;
00789     }
00790     else if (BLI_testextensie_array(relname, imb_ext_image) ||
00791              (G.have_quicktime && BLI_testextensie_array(relname, imb_ext_image_qt)))
00792     {
00793         return IMAGEFILE;           
00794     }
00795     else if (BLI_testextensie_array(relname, imb_ext_movie)) {
00796         return MOVIEFILE;           
00797     }
00798     else if (BLI_testextensie_array(relname, imb_ext_audio)) {
00799         return SOUNDFILE;
00800     } 
00801     return 0;
00802 }
00803 
00804 int ED_file_extension_icon(const char *relname)
00805 {
00806     int type= file_extension_type(relname);
00807     
00808     if (type == BLENDERFILE || type==BLENDERFILE_BACKUP)
00809         return ICON_FILE_BLEND;
00810     else if (type ==  IMAGEFILE)
00811         return ICON_FILE_IMAGE;
00812     else if (type ==  MOVIEFILE)
00813         return ICON_FILE_MOVIE;
00814     else if (type ==  PYSCRIPTFILE)
00815         return ICON_FILE_SCRIPT;
00816     else if (type ==  SOUNDFILE) 
00817         return ICON_FILE_SOUND;
00818     else if (type ==  FTFONTFILE) 
00819         return ICON_FILE_FONT;
00820     else if (type ==  BTXFILE) 
00821         return ICON_FILE_BLANK;
00822     else if (type ==  COLLADAFILE) 
00823         return ICON_FILE_BLANK;
00824     
00825     return ICON_FILE_BLANK;
00826 }
00827 
00828 static void filelist_setfiletypes(struct FileList* filelist)
00829 {
00830     struct direntry *file;
00831     int num;
00832     
00833     file= filelist->filelist;
00834     
00835     for (num=0; num<filelist->numfiles; num++, file++) {
00836         file->type= file->s.st_mode;    /* restore the mess below */ 
00837         
00838         /* Don't check extensions for directories */ 
00839         if (file->type & S_IFDIR) {
00840             continue;
00841         }
00842         file->flags = file_extension_type(file->relname);
00843         
00844         if (filelist->filter_glob &&
00845             BLI_testextensie_glob(file->relname, filelist->filter_glob))
00846         {
00847             file->flags= OPERATORFILE;
00848         }
00849         
00850     }
00851 }
00852 
00853 static void filelist_read_dir(struct FileList* filelist)
00854 {
00855     char wdir[FILE_MAX]= "";
00856     if (!filelist) return;
00857 
00858     filelist->fidx = NULL;
00859     filelist->filelist = NULL;
00860 
00861     BLI_current_working_dir(wdir, sizeof(wdir));     /* backup cwd to restore after */
00862 
00863     BLI_cleanup_dir(G.main->name, filelist->dir);
00864     filelist->numfiles = BLI_dir_contents(filelist->dir, &(filelist->filelist));
00865 
00866     if (!chdir(wdir)) {} /* fix warning about not checking return value */
00867     filelist_setfiletypes(filelist);
00868     filelist_filter(filelist);
00869 }
00870 
00871 static void filelist_read_main(struct FileList* filelist)
00872 {
00873     if (!filelist) return;
00874     filelist_from_main(filelist);
00875 }
00876 
00877 static void filelist_read_library(struct FileList* filelist)
00878 {
00879     if (!filelist) return;
00880     BLI_cleanup_dir(G.main->name, filelist->dir);
00881     filelist_from_library(filelist);
00882     if (!filelist->libfiledata) {
00883         int num;
00884         struct direntry *file;
00885 
00886         BLI_make_exist(filelist->dir);
00887         filelist_read_dir(filelist);
00888         file = filelist->filelist;
00889         for (num=0; num<filelist->numfiles; num++, file++) {
00890             if (BLO_has_bfile_extension(file->relname)) {
00891                 char name[FILE_MAX];
00892 
00893                 BLI_join_dirfile(name, sizeof(name), filelist->dir, file->relname);
00894 
00895                 /* prevent current file being used as acceptable dir */
00896                 if (BLI_path_cmp(G.main->name, name) != 0) {
00897                     file->type &= ~S_IFMT;
00898                     file->type |= S_IFDIR;
00899                 }
00900             }
00901         }
00902     }
00903 }
00904 
00905 void filelist_readdir(struct FileList* filelist)
00906 {
00907     filelist->readf(filelist);
00908 }
00909 
00910 int filelist_empty(struct FileList* filelist)
00911 {   
00912     return filelist->filelist == NULL;
00913 }
00914 
00915 void filelist_parent(struct FileList* filelist)
00916 {
00917     BLI_parent_dir(filelist->dir);
00918     BLI_make_exist(filelist->dir);
00919     filelist_readdir(filelist);
00920 }
00921 
00922 void filelist_select_file(struct FileList* filelist, int index, FileSelType select, unsigned int flag, FileCheckType check)
00923 {
00924     struct direntry* file = filelist_file(filelist, index);
00925     if (file != NULL) { 
00926         int check_ok = 0; 
00927         switch (check) {
00928             case CHECK_DIRS:
00929                 check_ok = S_ISDIR(file->type);
00930                 break;
00931             case CHECK_ALL:
00932                 check_ok = 1;
00933                 break;
00934             case CHECK_FILES:
00935             default:
00936                 check_ok = !S_ISDIR(file->type);
00937                 break;
00938         }
00939         if (check_ok) {
00940             switch (select) {
00941                 case FILE_SEL_REMOVE:
00942                     file->selflag &= ~flag;
00943                     break;
00944                 case FILE_SEL_ADD:
00945                     file->selflag |= flag;
00946                     break;
00947                 case FILE_SEL_TOGGLE:
00948                     file->selflag ^= flag;
00949                     break;
00950             }
00951         }
00952     }
00953 }
00954 
00955 void filelist_select(struct FileList* filelist, FileSelection* sel, FileSelType select, unsigned int flag, FileCheckType check)
00956 {
00957     /* select all valid files between first and last indicated */
00958     if ( (sel->first >= 0) && (sel->first < filelist->numfiltered) && (sel->last >= 0) && (sel->last < filelist->numfiltered) ) {
00959         int current_file;
00960         for (current_file = sel->first; current_file <= sel->last; current_file++) {    
00961             filelist_select_file(filelist, current_file, select, flag, check);
00962         }
00963     }
00964 }
00965 
00966 int filelist_is_selected(struct FileList* filelist, int index, FileCheckType check)
00967 {
00968     struct direntry* file = filelist_file(filelist, index);
00969     if (!file) {
00970         return 0;
00971     }
00972     switch (check) {
00973         case CHECK_DIRS:
00974             return S_ISDIR(file->type) && (file->selflag & SELECTED_FILE);
00975         case CHECK_FILES:
00976             return S_ISREG(file->type) && (file->selflag & SELECTED_FILE);
00977         case CHECK_ALL:
00978         default:
00979             return (file->selflag & SELECTED_FILE);
00980     }
00981 }
00982 
00983 void filelist_sort(struct FileList* filelist, short sort)
00984 {
00985     switch(sort) {
00986     case FILE_SORT_ALPHA:
00987         qsort(filelist->filelist, filelist->numfiles, sizeof(struct direntry), compare_name);   
00988         break;
00989     case FILE_SORT_TIME:
00990         qsort(filelist->filelist, filelist->numfiles, sizeof(struct direntry), compare_date);   
00991         break;
00992     case FILE_SORT_SIZE:
00993         qsort(filelist->filelist, filelist->numfiles, sizeof(struct direntry), compare_size);   
00994         break;
00995     case FILE_SORT_EXTENSION:
00996         qsort(filelist->filelist, filelist->numfiles, sizeof(struct direntry), compare_extension);  
00997     }
00998 
00999     filelist_filter(filelist);
01000 }
01001 
01002 
01003 int filelist_islibrary(struct FileList* filelist, char* dir, char* group)
01004 {
01005     return BLO_is_a_library(filelist->dir, dir, group);
01006 }
01007 
01008 static int groupname_to_code(const char *group)
01009 {
01010     char buf[32];
01011     char *lslash;
01012     
01013     BLI_strncpy(buf, group, sizeof(buf));
01014     lslash= BLI_last_slash(buf);
01015     if (lslash)
01016         lslash[0]= '\0';
01017 
01018     return BKE_idcode_from_name(buf);
01019 }
01020  
01021 void filelist_from_library(struct FileList* filelist)
01022 {
01023     LinkNode *l, *names, *previews;
01024     struct ImBuf* ima;
01025     int ok, i, nprevs, nnames, idcode;
01026     char filename[FILE_MAX];
01027     char dir[FILE_MAX], group[GROUP_MAX];   
01028     
01029     /* name test */
01030     ok= filelist_islibrary(filelist, dir, group);
01031     if (!ok) {
01032         /* free */
01033         if (filelist->libfiledata) BLO_blendhandle_close(filelist->libfiledata);
01034         filelist->libfiledata= NULL;
01035         return;
01036     }
01037     
01038     BLI_strncpy(filename, G.main->name, sizeof(filename));
01039 
01040     /* there we go */
01041     /* for the time being only read filedata when libfiledata==0 */
01042     if (filelist->libfiledata == NULL) {
01043         filelist->libfiledata= BLO_blendhandle_from_file(dir, NULL);
01044         if (filelist->libfiledata == NULL) return;
01045     }
01046     
01047     idcode= groupname_to_code(group);
01048 
01049     /* memory for strings is passed into filelist[i].relname
01050      * and freed in freefilelist */
01051     if (idcode) {
01052         previews= BLO_blendhandle_get_previews(filelist->libfiledata, idcode, &nprevs);
01053         names= BLO_blendhandle_get_datablock_names(filelist->libfiledata, idcode, &nnames);
01054         /* ugh, no rewind, need to reopen */
01055         BLO_blendhandle_close(filelist->libfiledata);
01056         filelist->libfiledata= BLO_blendhandle_from_file(dir, NULL);
01057         
01058     }
01059     else {
01060         previews= NULL;
01061         nprevs= 0;
01062         names= BLO_blendhandle_get_linkable_groups(filelist->libfiledata);
01063         nnames= BLI_linklist_length(names);
01064     }
01065 
01066     filelist->numfiles= nnames + 1;
01067     filelist->filelist= malloc(filelist->numfiles * sizeof(*filelist->filelist));
01068     memset(filelist->filelist, 0, filelist->numfiles * sizeof(*filelist->filelist));
01069 
01070     filelist->filelist[0].relname= BLI_strdup("..");
01071     filelist->filelist[0].type |= S_IFDIR;
01072         
01073     for (i=0, l= names; i<nnames; i++, l= l->next) {
01074         char *blockname= l->link;
01075 
01076         filelist->filelist[i + 1].relname= BLI_strdup(blockname);
01077         if (idcode) {
01078             filelist->filelist[i + 1].type |= S_IFREG;
01079         }
01080         else {
01081             filelist->filelist[i + 1].type |= S_IFDIR;
01082         }
01083     }
01084     
01085     if (previews && (nnames != nprevs)) {
01086         printf("filelist_from_library: error, found %d items, %d previews\n", nnames, nprevs);
01087     }
01088     else if (previews) {
01089         for (i=0, l= previews; i<nnames; i++, l= l->next) {
01090             PreviewImage *img= l->link;
01091             
01092             if (img) {
01093                 unsigned int w = img->w[ICON_SIZE_PREVIEW];
01094                 unsigned int h = img->h[ICON_SIZE_PREVIEW];
01095                 unsigned int *rect = img->rect[ICON_SIZE_PREVIEW];
01096 
01097                 /* first allocate imbuf for copying preview into it */
01098                 if (w > 0 && h > 0 && rect) {
01099                     ima = IMB_allocImBuf(w, h, 32, IB_rect);
01100                     memcpy(ima->rect, rect, w*h*sizeof(unsigned int));
01101                     filelist->filelist[i + 1].image = ima;
01102                     filelist->filelist[i + 1].flags = IMAGEFILE;
01103                 }
01104             }
01105         }
01106     }
01107 
01108     BLI_linklist_free(names, free);
01109     if (previews) BLI_linklist_free(previews, BKE_previewimg_freefunc);
01110 
01111     filelist_sort(filelist, FILE_SORT_ALPHA);
01112 
01113     BLI_strncpy(G.main->name, filename, sizeof(filename));  // prevent G.main->name to change
01114 
01115     filelist->filter = 0;
01116     filelist_filter(filelist);
01117 }
01118 
01119 void filelist_hideparent(struct FileList* filelist, short hide)
01120 {
01121     filelist->hide_parent = hide;
01122 }
01123 
01124 void filelist_from_main(struct FileList *filelist)
01125 {
01126     ID *id;
01127     struct direntry *files, *firstlib = NULL;
01128     ListBase *lb;
01129     int a, fake, idcode, ok, totlib, totbl;
01130     
01131     // filelist->type = FILE_MAIN; // XXXXX TODO: add modes to filebrowser
01132 
01133     if (filelist->dir[0]=='/') filelist->dir[0]= 0;
01134     
01135     if (filelist->dir[0]) {
01136         idcode= groupname_to_code(filelist->dir);
01137         if (idcode==0) filelist->dir[0]= 0;
01138     }
01139     
01140     if ( filelist->dir[0]==0) {
01141         
01142         /* make directories */
01143         filelist->numfiles= 24;
01144         filelist->filelist= (struct direntry *)malloc(filelist->numfiles * sizeof(struct direntry));
01145         
01146         for (a=0; a<filelist->numfiles; a++) {
01147             memset( &(filelist->filelist[a]), 0 , sizeof(struct direntry));
01148             filelist->filelist[a].type |= S_IFDIR;
01149         }
01150         
01151         filelist->filelist[0].relname= BLI_strdup("..");
01152         filelist->filelist[2].relname= BLI_strdup("Scene");
01153         filelist->filelist[3].relname= BLI_strdup("Object");
01154         filelist->filelist[4].relname= BLI_strdup("Mesh");
01155         filelist->filelist[5].relname= BLI_strdup("Curve");
01156         filelist->filelist[6].relname= BLI_strdup("Metaball");
01157         filelist->filelist[7].relname= BLI_strdup("Material");
01158         filelist->filelist[8].relname= BLI_strdup("Texture");
01159         filelist->filelist[9].relname= BLI_strdup("Image");
01160         filelist->filelist[10].relname= BLI_strdup("Ika");
01161         filelist->filelist[11].relname= BLI_strdup("Wave");
01162         filelist->filelist[12].relname= BLI_strdup("Lattice");
01163         filelist->filelist[13].relname= BLI_strdup("Lamp");
01164         filelist->filelist[14].relname= BLI_strdup("Camera");
01165         filelist->filelist[15].relname= BLI_strdup("Ipo");
01166         filelist->filelist[16].relname= BLI_strdup("World");
01167         filelist->filelist[17].relname= BLI_strdup("Screen");
01168         filelist->filelist[18].relname= BLI_strdup("VFont");
01169         filelist->filelist[19].relname= BLI_strdup("Text");
01170         filelist->filelist[20].relname= BLI_strdup("Armature");
01171         filelist->filelist[21].relname= BLI_strdup("Action");
01172         filelist->filelist[22].relname= BLI_strdup("NodeTree");
01173         filelist->filelist[23].relname= BLI_strdup("Speaker");
01174         filelist_sort(filelist, FILE_SORT_ALPHA);
01175     }
01176     else {
01177 
01178         /* make files */
01179         idcode= groupname_to_code(filelist->dir);
01180         
01181         lb= which_libbase(G.main, idcode );
01182         if (lb == NULL) return;
01183         
01184         id= lb->first;
01185         filelist->numfiles= 0;
01186         while (id) {
01187             if (!filelist->hide_dot || id->name[2] != '.') {
01188                 filelist->numfiles++;
01189             }
01190             
01191             id= id->next;
01192         }
01193         
01194         /* XXXXX TODO: if databrowse F4 or append/link filelist->hide_parent has to be set */
01195         if (!filelist->hide_parent) filelist->numfiles+= 1;
01196         filelist->filelist= filelist->numfiles > 0 ? (struct direntry *)malloc(filelist->numfiles * sizeof(struct direntry)) : NULL;
01197 
01198         files = filelist->filelist;
01199         
01200         if (!filelist->hide_parent) {
01201             memset( &(filelist->filelist[0]), 0 , sizeof(struct direntry));
01202             filelist->filelist[0].relname= BLI_strdup("..");
01203             filelist->filelist[0].type |= S_IFDIR;
01204         
01205             files++;
01206         }
01207         
01208         id= lb->first;
01209         totlib= totbl= 0;
01210         
01211         while (id) {
01212             ok = 1;
01213             if (ok) {
01214                 if (!filelist->hide_dot || id->name[2] != '.') {
01215                     memset( files, 0 , sizeof(struct direntry));
01216                     if (id->lib==NULL)
01217                         files->relname= BLI_strdup(id->name+2);
01218                     else {
01219                         files->relname= MEM_mallocN(FILE_MAX+32, "filename for lib");
01220                         sprintf(files->relname, "%s | %s", id->lib->name, id->name+2);
01221                     }
01222                     files->type |= S_IFREG;
01223 #if 0               // XXXXX TODO show the selection status of the objects
01224                     if (!filelist->has_func) { /* F4 DATA BROWSE */
01225                         if (idcode==ID_OB) {
01226                             if ( ((Object *)id)->flag & SELECT) files->selflag |= SELECTED_FILE;
01227                         }
01228                         else if (idcode==ID_SCE) {
01229                             if ( ((Scene *)id)->r.scemode & R_BG_RENDER) files->selflag |= SELECTED_FILE;
01230                         }                   
01231                     }
01232 #endif
01233                     files->nr= totbl+1;
01234                     files->poin= id;
01235                     fake= id->flag & LIB_FAKEUSER;
01236                     if (idcode == ID_MA || idcode == ID_TE || idcode == ID_LA || idcode == ID_WO || idcode == ID_IM) {
01237                         files->flags |= IMAGEFILE;
01238                     }
01239                     if (id->lib && fake) BLI_snprintf(files->extra, sizeof(files->extra), "LF %d", id->us);
01240                     else if (id->lib) BLI_snprintf(files->extra, sizeof(files->extra), "L    %d", id->us);
01241                     else if (fake) BLI_snprintf(files->extra, sizeof(files->extra), "F    %d", id->us);
01242                     else BLI_snprintf(files->extra, sizeof(files->extra), "      %d", id->us);
01243                     
01244                     if (id->lib) {
01245                         if (totlib==0) firstlib= files;
01246                         totlib++;
01247                     }
01248                     
01249                     files++;
01250                 }
01251                 totbl++;
01252             }
01253             
01254             id= id->next;
01255         }
01256         
01257         /* only qsort of library blocks */
01258         if (totlib>1) {
01259             qsort(firstlib, totlib, sizeof(struct direntry), compare_name);
01260         }
01261     }
01262     filelist->filter = 0;
01263     filelist_filter(filelist);
01264 }
01265 
01266 static void thumbnail_joblist_free(ThumbnailJob *tj)
01267 {
01268     FileImage* limg = tj->loadimages.first;
01269     
01270     /* free the images not yet copied to the filelist -> these will get freed with the filelist */
01271     for ( ; limg; limg= limg->next) {
01272         if ((limg->img) && (!limg->done)) {
01273             IMB_freeImBuf(limg->img);
01274         }
01275     }
01276     BLI_freelistN(&tj->loadimages);
01277 }
01278 
01279 static void thumbnails_startjob(void *tjv, short *stop, short *do_update, float *UNUSED(progress))
01280 {
01281     ThumbnailJob *tj= tjv;
01282     FileImage* limg = tj->loadimages.first;
01283 
01284     tj->stop= stop;
01285     tj->do_update= do_update;
01286 
01287     while ( (*stop==0) && (limg) ) {
01288         if ( limg->flags & IMAGEFILE ) {
01289             limg->img = IMB_thumb_manage(limg->path, THB_NORMAL, THB_SOURCE_IMAGE);
01290         }
01291         else if ( limg->flags & BLENDERFILE ) {
01292             limg->img = IMB_thumb_manage(limg->path, THB_NORMAL, THB_SOURCE_BLEND);
01293         }
01294         else if ( limg->flags & MOVIEFILE ) {
01295             limg->img = IMB_thumb_manage(limg->path, THB_NORMAL, THB_SOURCE_MOVIE);
01296             if (!limg->img) {
01297                     /* remember that file can't be loaded via IMB_open_anim */
01298                     limg->flags &= ~MOVIEFILE;
01299                     limg->flags |= MOVIEFILE_ICON;
01300                 }
01301         }
01302         *do_update = 1;
01303         PIL_sleep_ms(10);
01304         limg = limg->next;
01305     }
01306 }
01307 
01308 static void thumbnails_update(void *tjv)
01309 {
01310     ThumbnailJob *tj= tjv;
01311 
01312     if (tj->filelist && tj->filelist->filelist) {
01313         FileImage* limg = tj->loadimages.first;
01314         while (limg) {
01315             if (!limg->done && limg->img) {
01316                 tj->filelist->filelist[limg->index].image = limg->img;
01317                 /* update flag for movie files where thumbnail can't be created */
01318                 if (limg->flags & MOVIEFILE_ICON) {
01319                     tj->filelist->filelist[limg->index].flags &= ~MOVIEFILE;
01320                     tj->filelist->filelist[limg->index].flags |= MOVIEFILE_ICON;
01321                 }
01322                 limg->done=1;
01323             }
01324             limg = limg->next;
01325         }
01326     }
01327 }
01328 
01329 static void thumbnails_free(void *tjv)
01330 {
01331     ThumbnailJob *tj= tjv;
01332     thumbnail_joblist_free(tj);
01333     MEM_freeN(tj);
01334 }
01335 
01336 
01337 void thumbnails_start(struct FileList* filelist, const struct bContext* C)
01338 {
01339     wmJob *steve;
01340     ThumbnailJob *tj;
01341     int idx;
01342     
01343     /* prepare job data */
01344     tj= MEM_callocN(sizeof(ThumbnailJob), "thumbnails\n");
01345     tj->filelist = filelist;
01346     for (idx = 0; idx < filelist->numfiles;idx++) {
01347         if (!filelist->filelist[idx].image) {
01348             if ( (filelist->filelist[idx].flags & (IMAGEFILE|MOVIEFILE|BLENDERFILE)) ) {
01349                 FileImage* limg = MEM_callocN(sizeof(struct FileImage), "loadimage");
01350                 BLI_strncpy(limg->path, filelist->filelist[idx].path, FILE_MAX);
01351                 limg->index= idx;
01352                 limg->flags= filelist->filelist[idx].flags;
01353                 BLI_addtail(&tj->loadimages, limg);
01354             }
01355         }
01356     }
01357 
01358     BKE_reports_init(&tj->reports, RPT_PRINT);
01359 
01360     /* setup job */
01361     steve= WM_jobs_get(CTX_wm_manager(C), CTX_wm_window(C), filelist, "Thumbnails", 0);
01362     WM_jobs_customdata(steve, tj, thumbnails_free);
01363     WM_jobs_timer(steve, 0.5, NC_WINDOW, NC_WINDOW);
01364     WM_jobs_callbacks(steve, thumbnails_startjob, NULL, thumbnails_update, NULL);
01365 
01366     /* start the job */
01367     WM_jobs_start(CTX_wm_manager(C), steve);
01368 }
01369 
01370 void thumbnails_stop(struct FileList* filelist, const struct bContext* C)
01371 {
01372     WM_jobs_kill(CTX_wm_manager(C), filelist, NULL);
01373 }
01374 
01375 int thumbnails_running(struct FileList* filelist, const struct bContext* C)
01376 {
01377     return WM_jobs_test(CTX_wm_manager(C), filelist);
01378 }
